title: Niche overlap and resource partitioning graphs

content.question: The diagrams above show the range of tolerance for soil moisture content for two different species of terrestrial invertebrate: Species 1 and Species 2. The ranges represented are for each species where it occurs alone. Soil moisture content is a limiting factor for both species. If populations of both species are placed together in a new location, which of the following diagrams represents the most likely actual (realized) ranges of the speciesâ€™ distribution of individuals with respect to soil moisture content after five generations?

choices.label: Choice A is a graph with soil moisture content on the x-axis with 14 evenly spaced tick marks and number of organisms on the y-axis. It has two curves plotted, a solid curve for species 1 and a dashed curve for species 2. Choice A has the two curves on top of each other and they are exactly the same as the curve for species 1 in the figure in the prompt.

Choice B is a graph with soil moisture content on the x-axis with 14 evenly spaced tick marks and number of organisms on the y-axis. It has two curves plotted, a solid curve for species 1 and a dashed curve for species 2. Choice B has the two curves on top of each other and they are exactly the same as the curve for species 2 in the figure in the prompt.

Choice C is a graph with soil moisture content on the x-axis with 14 evenly spaced tick marks and number of organisms on the y-axis. It has two curves plotted, a solid curve for species 1 and a dashed curve for species 2. Choice C has the two curves on top of each other and they both start on the x-axis at the fifth tick mark, are increasing and concave up until the sixth tick mark, then are increasing and concave down until reaching a maximum at the top of the y-axis at the seventh tick mark, then are decreasing and concave down until the eighth tick mark, and are finally decreasing and concave up until reaching the x-axis at the ninth tick mark.

Choice E is a graph with soil moisture content on the x-axis with 14 evenly spaced tick marks and number of organisms on the y-axis. It has two curves plotted, a solid curve for species 1 and a dashed curve for species 2. Choice E has the dashed curve on the left starting at the origin, increasing and concave up until about the first tick mark, then increasing and concave down until reaching a maximum at the top of the y-axis between the second and third tick marks, then is decreasing and concave down until the fourth tick mark, and is finally decreasing and concave up until reaching the x-axis at the sixth tick mark. The solid curve has the same shape but is shifted to the left, starting at the ninth tick mark.

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain how environmental concepts and processes represented visually relate to broader environmental issues.
